reviews.review_msg: Professor Cooper is a fantastic professor! She has a way of drawing out very interesting points from class discussion. The seminars were always insightful and thought-provoking. The course involved a lot of readings and papers, but the workload was manageable. Overall, great course.

Professor Cooper is one of the best professors I've had at SFU. Not only does she have extensive experience and is brilliant, but she's easygoing and accessible. She assigns great, relevant books and focuses on theories as well as their practical applications. I'd definitely recommend Professor Cooper!

Material from interdisciplinary fields that we may have NOT been familiar with, but he expects you to understand it like if we been engaged with it all our lives. Very HARSH marker. He expects you to write word for word &criticizes ALL other readings, but his. He feels he is superior than others. Knowledgeable- But, a BAD teacher. Classes horrible

Harriss is the best prof I have had at SFU. He is extremely knowledgable and sharp, but still very kind and approachable. I learned more in his once class than I think I have in the rest of my first two years combined.

Professor Harriss is a great professor. His lectures are well structured and helped a lot for the papers. While he is somewhat quirky, it is clear that he really cares about his students. That being said, you will have to work very hard in his class. This is the most intense class I've taken but it was worth it.

He's a nice guy, very friendly and knowledgeable. A slow talker. He also isn't very helpful. He doesnt give criteria (because you shouldn't need instructions in 4th year) so I was trying to make sure I knew what to do, and he acted offended that I even asked. He barely talked about the assignment as if it wasn't even for marks.
He is extremely arrogant.  He obviously knows a lot but some people just are not born to teach.  He should stick to his research.

I've had Harriss for 101, 450 and 451. He's an articulate communicator and has extensive knowledge. He's friendly, and very helpful one on one. Lectures can be dry, but if you focus you get a lot out of them. I've never worked harder for a professor, but I've never learned so much either. If you can't put in the work, don't take IS.

Although a challenging class, it is well worth the effort. Harriss is not head of the department for nothing. He is a wealth of knowledge and when utilized properly can teach so much. Don't blame him for your laziness.
